1.body: I knew that if I failed I wouldn't regret that, but I knew the one thing I might regret is not trying.
1.author: Jeff Bezos

2.body: It's very easy to be different, but very difficult to be better.
2.author: Jonathan Ive

3.body: As a startup CEO, I slept like a baby. I woke up every 2 hours and cried.
3.author: Ben Horowitz

4.body: Don't worry about failure, you only have to be right once.
4.author: Drew Houston

5.body: Markets come and go. Good business don't.
5.author: Fred Wilson

6.body: You don't need to have a 100-person company to develop that idea.
6.author: Larry Page

7.body: Every feature has some maintenance cost, and having fewer features lets us focus on the ones we care about and make sure they work very well.
7.author: David Karp

8.body: It's better to make a few people really happy than to make a lot of people semi-happy.
8.author: Paul Graham

9.body: Don't try to be original, just try to be good.
9.author: Paul Rand

10.body: A 'startup' is a company that is confused about - 1. What its product is, 2. Who its customers are. 3. How to make money.
10.author: Dave McClure

11.body: If you are not embarrassed by the first version of your product, you've launched too late.
11.author: Reid Hoffman

12.body: Nothing works better than just improving your product.
12.author: Joel Spolsky

13.body: If there's something you want to build, but the tech isn't there yet, just find the closest possible way to make it happen.
13.author: Dennis Crowley

14.body: The most dangerous poison is the feeling of achievement. The antidote is to every evening think what can be done better tomorrow.
14.author: Ingvar Kamprad

15.body: Turn a perceived risk into an asset.
15.author: Aaron Patzer

16.body: Every feature has some maintenance cost, and having fewer features lets us focus on the ones we care about and make sure they work very well.
16.author: David Karp

17.body: It's not we need new ideas, but we need to stop having old ideas.
17.author: Edwin Land

18.body: Don't be cocky. Don't be flashy. There's always someone better than you.
18.author: Tony Hsieh

19.body: The value of an idea lies in the using of it.
19.author: Thomas Edison

20.body: Markets come and go. Good businesses don't.
20.author: Fred Wilson

21.body: Theory is splendid but until put into practice, it is valueless.
21.author: James Cash Penney

22.body: Anything that is measured and watched, improves.
22.author: Bob Parsons

23.body: The key to getting a reputation for being brilliant is actually being brilliant, not just acting like you are.
23.author: Seth Godin

24.body: Fortunes are built during the down market and collected in the up market.
24.author: Jason Calacanis

25.body: The world hates change, yet it is the only thing that has brought progress.
25.author: Charles F. Kettering

26.body: To the user, the interface is the product.
26.author: Aza Raskin

27.body: Don't find fault, find a remedy. Anybody can complain.
27.author: Henry Ford

28.body: Being the richest man in the cemetery doesn't matter to me. Going to bed at  night saying we've done something wonderful, that's what matters to me.
28.author: Steve Jobs

29.body: When you are small, you have to be very focused and rely on your brain, not your strength.
29.author: Jack Ma

30.body: When you're a one man show you have to focus on the most important thing to get done today.
30.author: Noah Everett

31.body: Running a startup is like being punched in the face repeatedly, but working for a large company is like being waterboarded.
31.author: Paul Graham

32.body: No more romanticizing about how cool it is to be an entrepreneur. It's a struggle to save your company's lilfe - and your own skin - every day of the week.
32.author: Spencer Fry

33.body: Never, never, never, hire people with an attitude. You will regret it.
33.author: Omar Hamoui

34.body: The secret to successful hiring is this: look for the people who want to change the world.
34.author: Marc Benioff

35.body: The only way people will have the trust to give their all to their job is if they feel like their contribution is recognized and valued.
35.author: Mark Pincus

36.body: I try not to make any decisions that I'm not excited about.
36.author: Jake Nickell

37.body: A milestone is less date and more definition.
37.author: Michael Lopp

38.body: See things in the present, even if they are in the future.
38.author: Larry Ellison

39.body: The essence of profound insight is simplicity.
39.author: Jim Collins

40.body: If you're going to put your product in beta - put your business model in beta with it.
40.author: Joe Kraus

41.body: I'm always afraid of failing. It's great motivation to work harder.
41.author: Mark Cuban

42.body: Bootstrapping is a way to do something about the problems you have without letting someone else give you permission to do them.
42.author: Tom Preston-Werner

43.body: You can't make anything viral, but you can make something good.
43.author: Peter Shankman

44.body: It's more effective to do something valuable than to hope a logo or name will say it for you.
44.author: Jason Cohen

45.body: Make every detail perfect and limit the number of details to perfect.
45.author: Jack Dorsey

46.body: Recessions are great because they unlock the best people.
46.author: Aaron Patzer

47.body: It became an exercise to reduce and reduce, but it makes it easier to build an easier for people to work with.
47.author: Jonathan Ive

48.body: For every new feature we add, we take an old one out. A lot of big sites don't do that, and it's a problem.
48.author: David Karp

49.body: Your biggest challenge will be building a great team.
49.author: John Doerr

50.body: When you have to prove the value of your ideas by persuading other people to pay for them, it clears out an awful lot of woolly thinking.
50.author: Tim O'Reilly

51.body: If there are too many competitors, even if you're the best it's a lot harder to win.
51.author: Tony Hsieh

52.body: Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work. And the only way to do great work is to love what you do.
52.author: Steve Jobs

53.body: Don't worry about funding if you don't need it. Today it's cheaper to start a business than ever.
53.author: Noah Everett

54.body: When something really shitty happens we try not to take it personally, figuring that tomorrow is another day.
54.author: Mike Hudack

55.body: Ideas are commodity. Execution of them is not.
55.author: Michael Dell

56.body: Success and profitability are outcomes of focusing on customers and employees, not objectives.
56.author: Jack Ma

58.body: It's simple until you make it complicated.
58.author: Jason Fried

59.body: Most people are searching for a path to success that is both easy and certain. Most paths are neither.
59.author: Seth Godin

60.body: We tell ourselves we're here to be flexible and to be nimble, and not necessarily to stick to a master plan.
60.author: Ben Huh

61.body: Ideas that most people derided as ridiculous have produced the best outcomes. Don't do the obvious thing.
61.author: Fred Wilson

63.body: Creativity is the sudden cessation of stupidity.
63.author: Edwin Land

64.body: Learn not to add too many features right away, and get the core idea built and tested.
64.author: Leah Culver

65.body: Do what you love and the rest will come.
65.author: Dennis Crowley

66.body: Talk to your customers. Find out what they need. Don't pay any attention to the competition. They're not relevant to you.
66.author: Joel Spolsky

67.body: When things change, I think that's easy to get really wrapped up in the complaints.
67.author: Scott Heiferman

68.body: Customer research produces bland products. We're producing a piece of art.
68.author: Michael Arrington

69.body: Big companies are almost always far too slow to actually kill a small competitor.
69.author: Omar Hamoui

70.body: Hire the best people you can find. You will sleep better at night.
70.author: Bijan Sabet

71.body: Good is the enemy of great.
71.author: Jim Collins

72.body: I'd like to show an improved product rather than just talk about things we might do.
72.author: Mark Zuckerberg

73.body: No one gives a damn about the size of your to-do list.
73.author: Ryan Freitas

74.body: You've found market price when buyers complain but still pay.
74.author: Paul Graham

75.body: There's nothing that will bring realism into your world as quickly as realizing that you're out of cash.
75.author: David Heinemeier Hansson

76.body: I'd build stuff that's awesome and get people using it. Investors will come out of the woodwork when you do.
76.author: David Cohen

77.body: Make your team feel respected, empowered, and genuinely excited about the company's mission.
77.author: Tim Westergren

78.body: We need to accept that we won't always make the right decisions, that we'll screw up royally sometimes - understanding that failure is not the opposite of success, it's part of success.
78.author: Arianna Huffington

79.body: You can pivot a product, but not a user base.
79.author: Gary Chou

80.body: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
80.author: Thomas Edison

81.body: It's a good thing that at a startup, being stressed is often balanced by being excited. Otherwise the stress would kill you.
81.author: Sachin Agarwal

82.body: Finding out about the competition was the best thing to happen to us since it forced us to lean forward, accelerating our launch.
82.author: Rebecca Woodcock

83.body: If you give people really big jobs to the point that they're scared, they have way more fun and they improve their game much faster.
83.author: Mark Pincus

84.body: It may be easier than ever to start a product, but building a company is just as hard as its ever been.
84.author: Sarah Lacy

85.body: Learn by doing. Theory is nice, but nothing replaces actual experience.
85.author: Tony Hsieh

86.body: Do what you love and don't focus on money - life's too short.
86.author: Matt Mullenweg

87.body: It's about doing things that you haven't done before, where you're still kind of a beginner, and not resting on your laurels.
87.author: Caterina Fake

88.body: Everyone tells you how they are going to be "special", but few do the work to get there. Do the work.
88.author: Mark Cuban

89.body: Charge for something and make more than you spend.
89.author: Marco Arment

90.body: We try to solve very complicated problems without letting people know how complicated the problem was.
90.author: Jonathan Ive

91.body: Startup success is driven most by the product passion, quality, vision, team-work and persistence of the founding team and the talent that the team attracts.
91.author: Jim Breyer

92.body: Design is a career where you learn creative decision making.
92.author: Biz Stone

93.body: Every time you make the user make a decision they don't care about, you have failed as a designer.
93.author: Aza Raskin

94.body: Don't get ahead of yourself. Companies need time to figure out what they want to be.
94.author: Bart Decrem

95.body: You can achieve a shallow local maximum with A/B testing - but you'll never win hearts and minds.
95.author: Jeff Atwood

96.body: It's much better to start during an economic downturn. Partnerships are easier; hiring is easier; and the competition starts later.
96.author: Reid Hoffman

97.body: The compromise of two visions don't make a right.
97.author: Sean Rad

98.body: You need to fail quickly. If you think you know what's going to work in any aspect of your startup, you are wrong.
98.author: Chuck Gordon

99.body: Entrepreneur is someone who has a vision for something and a want to create.
99.author: David Karp

101.body: Simple things should be simple, complex things should be possible.
101.author: Alan Kay

102.body: Fearlessness is like a muscle. I know from my own life that the more I exercise it the more natural it becomes to not let my fears run me.
102.author: Arianna Huffington

103.body: Customers want new functionality, but they don't want the traditional complexity that has marred products in the past.
103.author: Marc Benioff

104.body: Listen to your customers, not your competitors.
104.author: Joel Spolsky

105.body: Play a new game, not the older game but faster.
105.author: Seth Godin

106.body: Don't leave hold of your common sense. Think about what you're doing and how the technology can enhance it. Don't think about technology first.
106.author: Esther Dyson

108.body: Good entrepreneurs have a chip on their shoulders. They are out to prove something.
108.author: Mark Suster

109.body: Sometimes life hits you in the head with a brick. Don't lose faith.
109.author: Steve Jobs

110.body: How can you expect someone to get a good day's work if they are interrupted all day?
110.author: Jason Fried

111.body: Solve a real problem and the world is yours.
111.author: Aaron Patzer

112.body: Get your idea out in the wild, iterate your ass off, and hopefully build something spectacular.
112.author: Kyle Bragger

113.body: When you're forced to be simple, you're forced to face the real problem.
113.author: Paul Graham

114.body: Marry the problem, not the solution.
114.author: Dan Greenberg

115.body: Early in a startup, product decisions should be hunch driven. Later on, product decisions should be data driven.
115.author: Fred Wilson

116.body: By precipitating change, you'll create value. Those that do this best will win.
116.author: Ben Keighran

117.body: If you don't have a passion for your customers... you won't create a company - you'll create a job.
117.author: Dan Martell

118.body: Experience is great but never let it stand in the way of progress.
118.author: Boris Veldhuijzen van Zanten

119.body: You make your own luck. Every single minute of every day.
119.author: Hiten Shah

120.body: Less is more. Ask yourself: is your product more like 140 characters in Twitter or the MS Office ribbon bar.
120.author: Bijan Sabet

121.body: Any time you build a company designed to be sold, you ultimately get less value if it's sold.
121.author: Joe Kraus

122.body: Think of it as you want it, not as it is!
122.author: Larry Ellison

123.body: Remember: It's not innovation until it gets built.
123.author: Garry Tan

125.body: Make sure the thing you are working on is something you love.
125.author: Brad Feld

126.body: Making mistakes of all types and consequences is part of an entrepreneur's journey, the only real failure is not trying.
126.author: Jeff Clavier

127.body: If you're interested in the living heart of what you do, focus on building things rather than talking about them.
127.author: Ryan Freitas

128.body: People will pay for something they like because they want to ensure its future.
128.author: Marco Arment

129.body: If you're not working on your best idea right now, you're doing it wrong.
129.author: David Heinemeier Hansson

130.body: Hire great people and give them freedom to be awesome.
130.author: Andrew Mason

131.body: Love what you do and who you do it for. The rest will come naturally.
131.author: David Cohen

132.body: Usage is like oxygen for ideas. You can never fully anticipate how an audience is going to react to something you've created until it's out there.
132.author: Matt Mullenweg

133.body: Do or do not. There is no try.
133.author: Yoda

134.body: Everything's impossible until somebody does it.
134.author: Bruce Wayne

135.body: It's not always the most popular person who gets the job done.
135.author: Gordon Gekko

136.body: Mama always said life was like a box of chocolates. You never know what you're gonna get.
136.author: Forrest Gump

137.body: Sometimes you gotta run before you can walk.
137.author: Tony Stark

138.body: Simplicity and common sense should characterize planning and strategic direction.
138.author: Ingvar Kamprad

139.body: Design is more important than technology in most consumer applications.
139.author: Dave McClure

140.body: The utmost thing is the user experience, to have the most useful experience.
140.author: Marissa Mayer

141.body: When I'm hiring, I don't look for credentials, I look for knowledge.
141.author: Aza Raskin

142.body: The young and the ambitious share a common risk: appearing naive.
142.author: Scott Belsky

143.body: People are not good at expressing their frustration. The best way to listen to the customer is through metrics.
143.author: Chris Hughes

144.body: If you have an idea that you can't get out of your head, do a startup. Otherwise join a startup.
144.author: Fred Wilson

145.body: Every day that we spent not improving our products was a wasted day.
145.author: Joel Spolsky

146.body: Just build something that you'd want to use today, not something you think people could use somehow.
146.author: Paul Graham

147.body: The strongest thing you can cultivate as an entrepreneur is to not rely on luck but cultivating an ability to recognize fortunate situations when they are occurring.
147.author: Jack Dorsey

148.body: You have got to be willing to be poor as an entrepreneur.
148.author: Sean Parker

149.body: You have to solve a problem that people actually have. But it's not always a problem that they know they have, so that's tricky.
149.author: Joshua Schachter

150.body: Find the leverage in the world so you can be truly lazy.
150.author: Larry Page

151.body: Ambition and hard work go hand-in-hand.
151.author: Adii Pienaar

152.body: I built a system simple enough to sustain itself.
152.author: Pierre Omidyar

153.body: If you make something good and put it out there, people will pass it along.
153.author: Gregg Spiridellis

154.body: You never want to be completely alone at what you do. Competition is good for everyone.
154.author: Marc Benioff

155.body: You don't need a business plan. You don't need to have an MBA. All you need is a great idea. Anything is possible and you can accomplish it.
155.author: Ron Conway
